page.title: 17FARM & PUBLIC HOUSE,HURLEY
page.content: {FROGMILL FARM,HURLEY This consists of about 1000 acres. The farm land was previously marsh. Today, there are 247 acres of barley, 283 acres of wheat,94 acres of seed rape,40 acres of calabrese for local supermarkets,200 acres of grazing land and 12 acres of strawberries, raspberries,peas and beans.The farm also has 600 pigs,180 cows and a flock of Jacob sheep. {THE BLACK BOY Near Frogmill Farm is the wayside inn called The Black Boy.It is owned by Brakspears,the local Henley brewery and has been in existence since the 16th century.
